meanings.definition: Protect (something) by interposing material that prevents the loss of heat or the intrusion of sound.
meanings.sent1: The builders insulated the house to keep it warm in winter.
meanings.sent2: She insulated her water bottle to keep her drink cold for longer.
meanings.sent3: The cat insulated itself under the cozy blanket.
meanings.sent4: His kind words insulated her from the harsh criticism.
meanings.sent5: The thick walls insulated the room from the noisy street outside.

meanings.definition: Prevent the passage of electricity to or from (something) by covering it in nonconducting material.
meanings.sent1: The electrician insulated the wires to avoid any accidents.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to always insulate electrical appliances for safety.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel insulated its nest with leaves and twigs.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude insulated her from negative energy.
meanings.sent5: Insulating the cables protected them from power surges.
